articles.author: Tom Ough
articles.title: Woolly mammoths are making a comeback. Should we eat them? - The Independent
articles.description: A Texas start-up is using genetic engineering to revive that most iconic of extinct animals. But the woolly mammoth’s potential return sparks a number of ethical questions, says Tom Ough. Namely: which supermarket will line up to stock chunks of them first?
articles.content:
And what hairy beast, its hour come at last, slouches towards a laboratory to be born?
Some 3,900 years ago, on mainland Siberia, the last known woolly mammoth breathed its last. Since then, humans … [+8609 chars]

articles.title: Scientists baffled: Earth's rotation 'wobbles' as it moves further away from Sun - Express
articles.description: A DISCOVERY has found that the Earth has been mysteriously spinning faster, while also moving further away from the Sun.

articles.title: In pictures: The Cartwheel Galaxy and the other universe mysteries revealed by James Webb - Euronews
articles.description: The powerful telescope has been able to look through the dust surrounding the Cartwheel Galaxy right into its bright core.
